data.title: It's ITALIAN  it has to  be good.
data.text: Since 1948 when I first came to California and missed all the great Italian Deli's in Rochester New York, my Aunt said don't worry we have Claro's. So since then I have gone to Claro's for some of the best Italian Sausage, and imported cold cuts, good bread and all the fixings for all my favorite dishes.My family might miss Christmas Eve if the first course wasn't all the goodies from Claro's. So I don't disappoint them and go on December 23, usually waiting outside and first in line. Then buy half the store out and go home to start Christmas Eve. The rest of the year I make weekly trips to keep all the great food they have to offer. Imported Cheeses, and meats, and Olives, and Oils and everything you could ever want for great Italian fixings they have.Good cookies and pastries too.

data.title: Welcome to the New World!
data.text: Claro's is one of the last surviving legitimate Italian markets/delis in Southern California. It still has several locations to serve second and third-generation Italian-Americans and others who know of its reputation. I still like going there, but I sense the owners have gotten a little complacent which is unfortunate for patrons, and them. With places like Vons now having access to some of the best imported salami and mortadella, etc., you would think Claro's would try harder these days. But they still sometimes serve you like you are a bother--unless you are a regular but even the deli staff can pull a New York attitude on you and....this ain't Mulberry Street! How about dumping the inconvenient hours, opening the Friday after Thanksgiving, improving your wine offerings, not outsourcing cannolis and otherwise work to keep your reputation strong for future generations? That's an offer that shouldn't be refused...

data.title: Ciao Bella
data.text: Claro's would be just another Italian deli in New York City, but in this mostly Asian area, it is unique. The homemade daily hot foods are all good, especially the peppers and sausage. Their can be a long wait during lunch for a sandwich because the meats and cheeses are of the highest quality and often imported. If you like and can afford the best Italian salami, this is your place. Have the sandwich with a Peroni, not a Budwesier..and if you ever talk craft beer here, the no non-sense owners/staff might call you out on your bad "pairing"

data.title: So yummy.
data.text: If you love Italian food or want to make Italian food come to Claro's. They have warm food and delicatessens all fresh.

data.title: Fantastic Italian Fare from Real Italians
data.text: This was my second visit to Claro's in Arcadia, whose sandwiches and stuffed peppers (stuffed with provolone and prosciutto) are among my favorite meals anywhere.  My wife and I are huge fans of Italy, and just walking through Claro's market, we were able to relive some of our memories of our visit to Italy a few years ago.  I even got to practice some of my very weak Italian with the lady who made my sandwich.  Their prices are extremely reasonable and you get a lot of food for your money.  On this second visit, I actually went to Claro's before I went to my hotel.

data.title: The place was an ode to Italia, filled with varieties that I had never seen or heard of
data.text:
"Chris took me to an authentic Italian market and deli named Claro's for lunch, and as a big fan of Italian food, I was in awe at the range of products on offer. From fresh Italian sausage, to cheeses, to pasta, and all sorts of other groceries, the place was an ode to Italia, filled with varieties that I had never seen or heard of. "

(taken from a blog post on http://www.theeaglesnestza.com/2013/07/13/welcome-to-the-jungle-los-angeles/)

data.title: good Italian deli
data.text: I visit regularly to but imported pasta and semolina flour, among other hard to find items. The bakery produces good bread and outstanding cookies. At the deli counter they make fine sandwiches and other ready to eat items.

data.title: Probably my favorite market to look around. Super cheap dry pasta.
data.text: Probably my favorite market to look around. Super cheap dry pasta.
